Dear Mrs. Fernandez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 For repeats violations, why the prior CAP did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (248) 975-5053.

ALLEGATION:
Staff at facility admitted on record that youth has not been provided therapeutic
services in over three months when they are supposed to be receiving these
services 3 times per week.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received on 09/29/2021 from the DCWL online complaint
website. No contact information was available for the complainant. The information
from the complaint states, “On 09/28/2021 Staff at the facility admitted on record that
Youth A has not been provided therapeutic services in over three months when he is
supposed to be receiving these services 3 times per week while at the residential
placement.”
A second complaint was received on 10/12/2021 from the DCWL on-line complaint
website. The complaint states the following. “Youth B was admitted to the facility on
09/10/2021 and has not been assigned a therapist. Per Youth B he does not have a
therapist and has not been in anyone’s office for therapy.”
I met with Administrator 1 at the facility on 09/30/2021 and advised her of the
allegation. Administrator 1 reported that she is filling in for the CA who is currently on
medical leave. She acknowledges that they have been short staffed in the therapy
department, but she is not aware that Youth A’s has not been receiving therapy for 3
months.
I interviewed Youth A on-site on 09/30/2021. Regarding the allegations, Youth A
reported that he has been participating in group therapy but has not had individual
therapy for several weeks. He reported his therapist left and he has not been
assigned a new therapist. He could not recall the date of his last session he had
with his therapist. He has a weekly check in when his case manager at the facility.
Youth A reported he feels safe, gets enough to eat, and takes his medication daily.
I interviewed Staff 1 on site on 09/30/2021. He reported he was present during
Youth A’s court hearing. He denied that Youth A has not received therapy in 3
months. He reported Youth A’s therapy has been inconsistent because his therapist
resigned, and he currently does not have a therapist assigned. He does not know
when Youth A’s last individual therapy session was. He reported Youth A is
participating in weekly group therapy. He reported the Youth’s GAL is the one who
reported Youth A has not received therapy in months.
I interviewed Director of Behavioral Health on-site on 09/30/2021. He reported Youth
A is required to have a least one individual therapy session and one group session
weekly. Youth A is diagnosed with ADHD, and disruptive mood disorder. He
reported that Youth A’s therapist resigned on 09/29/2021 and Youth A does not
currently have a therapist assigned to him. He does not know when the last therapy
session Youth A had with his therapist and will need to review the therapist notes to
provide that information. He reported Youth A has been participating in weekly group
3

therapy and provided the weekly group therapy reports for the months of July,
August, and September.
I spoke with Youth A’s DHHS worker on 10/01/2021 via telephone. She reported
Youth A’s individual therapy has been inconsistent because of his assigned therapist
resigning. She stated Youth A has been having group therapy weekly. She further
reported Youth A has been having frequent contact with his case manager and
support staff at the facility.
I interviewed Staff 2 on 10/04/2021 via telephone. She is Youth A’s case manager.
She reported there has been inconsistency in Youth A’s individual therapy because
he has had different therapists assigned due to them resigning, and therefore he has
missed some individual therapy. She has been meeting with him twice a week and
he has been doing well. Youth A turned 18 last week and the transition plan for him
is to go live with his father out of state.
I interviewed Youth B on site on 10/15/2021. He has been at the facility for one
month. He reported he is doing well, but he gets upset when the boys in his cottage
cuss and swear. He reported he had his first therapy session last week on
Thursday. He indicated he gets enough food, feels safe, and takes his medication
daily.
I interviewed Director of Behavioral Health on-site on 10/15/2021. He reported Youth
B has been at the facility since 09/10/21 and did not start receiving therapy until
10/07/21. Youth B had his first therapy session on 10/07/2021. He stated that they
had several therapists resign and that has impacted some of the youths receiving
individual therapy, but he has been filling in and provided individual therapy for those
youths.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 10/21/21 via telephone. She reported that she is currently
the assigned therapist for Youth B. She had the first individual session with Youth B
on 10/07/2021. She reported Youth B has adjusted to his placement and is doing
well.
I received an email from Director of Behavioral Health on 10/21/21. He reported
Youth A’s previous therapist did not log the notes in the system, so while the
appointments were placed in the system, the notes following were never
generated. This therapist then left with half of their work undone and did not
communicate this to the supervisor. Subsequently, the therapist taking over the case
left shortly after and did not meet with Youth A, so from May to August 2021 Youth
A’s Individual therapy could not verified.
I received an email from Youth’s B Foster Care Specialist. She stated Youth B was
placed at the facility in early September 2021. Youth B did not start therapy until
10/07/2021. She had contact with the Director or Behavioral Health and he had
4

reported Youth B did not began therapy at the time of placement due to being short
staffed.
Documents reviewed as part of the investigation:
 Youth A’s Updated Services Plan dated 06/08/21 through 09/05/2021.
Section D states Youth A is to receive individual therapy twice weekly and
group therapy weekly.
 Youth A’s weekly group therapy log forms from July to September 2021
confirm Youth A was receiving weekly group therapy.
 Youth’s B treatment plan was reviewed, and he should be receiving weekly
individual therapy.
APPLICABLE Contract
2.10 Services to be Provided
n. Individual or Group Therapy
The Contractor must provide at a minimum weekly direct
therapy services for each youth individually; group therapy
can be used as an adjunct treatment. Individual and/or
group therapy must be provided in accordance with the
youth’s treatment needs as identified in the youth’s service
plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the contract as Staff and Youths
interviewed acknowledged Youth A has not been receiving
weekly individual therapy and Youth B did not receive individual
therapy from 09/10/2021 to 10/07/2021 as stated in their
contract.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
All scheduled and unscheduled individual, group, and family
therapy sessions by a master’s level therapist must be
documented to verify youth are receiving the appropriate
therapeutic services according to their treatment plan.
The facility is advised to outline the frequency of individual and
group therapy in their program statement and policies.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
